answers.answer: I don't understand why the hospital hasn't induced you already....you're already at term and having blood pressure that high is extremely dangerous.

I had one high BP at my 32 week appointment and 2 more high blood pressures at my 39 week appointment and they induced me that day. And by high, I mean barely over 140/90 each time. Of course once they started the induction all of my BPs were perfect and around 115/75... I too am surprised your doctor hasn't already induced you if your BP is that high regularly.

I was feeling the same way! It's my ob. He keeps telling them to send me home. So I'm thinking its time to demand they do something. Right? I cant sit around anymore and let him do this to me and my baby. I'd love to stay pregnant as long as possible but not with a risk like this.
Its been this high for three weeks now.
Can you get a second opinion? Is there an OB on call at the ER you went to?
Ive had two obs tell me they are concerned but they always call my ob and let him decide. They say he's in charge of me and makes the choices.

I had high blood pressure prior to being pregnant. Up until about 28 weeks it stayed low enough with meds that they weren't concerned. I'm 35 weeks now and today when I saw the high risk doctor it was 154/100. He immediately sent me to the ob to have blood work done and for the ob to assess me. Now we wait for the results to come back tomorrow and they will decide whether to induce me now or if it's safe to monitor me until I hit 37 weeks and induce me then. However he told me if I developed bad headaches, dizziness, shortness of breath, saw spots, had ringing in my ears or started vomiting not to wait to go to the hospital immediately. Hoping they find a resolution for you.

Your story is very similar to mine. My tests came back negative and now...he's just letting me run high. That's really good to know about what your obgyn said. Thanks for telling me. Im here at the office now and I'm going to get some answers.
I'm getting induced tomorrow. He told me the hospital gets "uppity" about inducing before 39 weeks and said he was going to label me preeclamtic. I'm nervous but glad. I think its for the best.
Glad someone talked some sense into him ;-)  Best of luck!

question: I feel like my on is not taking my high blood pressure seriously. I'm 38 weeks and my blood pressure is running about 160/100 regularly. I've been in the er for it and the doctor there was very concerned. I don't have preeclampsia. For moms out there who were induced for hypertension how high did it get? How long was it that high? Did you have any high blood pressure before pregnancy?
title: when did your hypertension lead to induction?
